name: California Institute of Technology
departments: Graduate Aerospace Laboratories of the California Institute of Technology (GALCIT)
schoolDescription: CalTech is a private, independent science and engineering institute and research university emphasizing scientific leadership, with most of its students studying physics, biology, engineering, and mathematical disciplines. Caltech manages the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) for NASA.
accreditation: Caltech receives regional accreditation from WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC).
engineeringDevisionDescription: Most well known for its influence on the aerospace industry, GALCIT is Caltech’s graduate research department. Currently, the department facilitates students’ and faculty’s research on space science and technology, micro- and nano-mechanics, and biosystems engineering.

name: California State University Long Beach
schoolDescription: Cal State Long Beach is a public institution within the California State University system. CSU Long Beach offers four-year degrees, graduate programs, and certificate programs.
accreditation: CSULB receives regional accreditation from WASC Senior College and University Commission.

name: Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University - Worldwide and Online Campus
campusLocation: 1 Aerospace Boulevard, Daytona Beach, FL 32114-3900  3700 Willow Creek Road, Prescott, AZ 86301-3720
schoolDescription: Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is a private institution and one of the largest accredited university systems dedicated to aviation and aerospace.
accreditation: Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University  is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges.

name: University of California, Los Angeles
departments: Henry Samueli School of Engineering and Applied Science
schoolDescription: The University of California, Los Angeles is a public research institution within the University of California system. UCLA offers four-year degrees, graduate programs, and certificate programs.
accreditation: The University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC).
engineeringDevisionDescription: UCLA Engineering is named after Dr. Henry Samueli, Ph.D., an alumnus, former professor of the university, and co-founder of Broadcom Corporation. UCLA Engineering emphasizes interdisciplinary research across seven departments: bioengineering, chemical and biomolecular engineering, civil and environmental engineering, computer science, electrical and computer engineering, materials science and engineering, and mechanical and aerospace engineering.

name: University of Southern California
schoolDescription: University of Southern California is a private research university offering four-year undergraduate degree programs, graduate degree programs, certificate courses.
accreditation: USC is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC)
engineeringDevisionDescription: Viterbi Engineering is named after Andrew Viterbi, an alumnus of USC, engineer, and co-founder of Qualcomm Inc. Dr. Viterbi is also the inventor of the Viterbi algorithm. USC Viterbi emphasizes bringing together learning theory with practical application to foster innovative engineers.

accreditation: Irvine Valley College is accredited by the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (ACCJC) of the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC).

name: University of California, Irvine
departments: Henry Samueli School of Engineering at UC Irvine

engineeringDevisionDescription: UCI Samueli School of Engineering is named after Dr. Henry Samueli, Ph.D., a University of California alumnus, former UCI adjunct professor, and co-founder of Broadcom Corporation. UCI Samueli School of Engineering oversees undergraduate and graduate programs in biomedical engineering; chemical and biomolecular engineering; civil and environmental engineering; electrical engineering and computer science; materials science and engineering; and mechanical and aerospace engineering.

name: University of California, Riverside
departments: The Marlan and Rosemary Bourns College of Engineering at UC Riverside (BCOE)
schoolDescription: The University of California, Riverside is a public research institution within the University of California system. UC Riverside offers four-year degrees, graduate programs, and certificate programs.
accreditation: The University of California, Riverside is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC).
engineeringDevisionDescription: Named after the founders of Bourns, Inc., Bourns Engineering oversees undergraduate and graduate programs bioengineering; chemical and environmental engineering; computer science and engineering; computer engineering, electrical engineering; mechanical engineering and materials science and engineering. Bournes Engineering is well-known for its research centers, most notably the Center for Environmental Research and Technology, the Center for Nanoscale Science and Engineering, and the Center for Research and Intelligent Systems.

engineeringDevisionDescription: The Technology and aviation division at GCC oversees programs in aviation and transportation; computer integrated manufacturing; computer-aided manufacturing and machine technology; engineering; welding and metallurgy; and more.

name: Loyola Marymount University

engineeringDevisionDescription: Named after philanthropist Frank Seaver, Loyola Marymount University’s College of Science and Engineering emphasizes experiential and interdisciplinary learning that prepares students for success after graduation. Graduate education at Seaver College of Science and Engineering is rigorous and innovative to ensure that students learn in the context of the greatest challenges facing society today.
